benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: Valid Deletion: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC05) verify successful deletion of all or specific tags and expected 204 responses.
Empty Response: TC04 verifies behavior when invoice item has no tags (empty body, 204).
Query Parameters: tagDef variations covered (present, subset, empty, malformed, very large, partial) in TC02, TC05, TC06, TC13, TC14, TC16.
Header handling: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy presence and missing header tested (TC03, TC10). Optional headers X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment covered (TC03, TC18).
Input Validation / Error codes: Invalid invoiceItemId format and non-existent id covered (TC08, TC09) matching 400/404 error scenarios in the story.
Authentication / Authorization: Invalid or expired token covered (TC11).
Service error handling: Service unavailable scenario covered (TC12).
Concurrency & Performance: High concurrency scenario included (TC17) to test race conditions and performance boundaries.
Security: XSS/injection attempts in headers considered (TC15).
Integration / Regression: Integration with dependent service (audit logging) and regression with special characters covered (TC19, TC18).
Accessibility & Documentation: API documentation/error message accessibility scenario present (TC20).
gaps: Pagination: No tests — though DELETE typically is not paginated, there is no explicit confirmation that bulk removals or listing behavior related to tags will behave with large sets; story and guidelines mention pagination for GET endpoints (not directly applicable) but bulk/tagDef large-set behaviors are partially addressed in TC14 only as a limit edge case.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No explicit tests for rate limiting or API throttling under repeated rapid requests (guideline coverage missing).

Caching Behavior: No scenarios verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or client caching implications — guideline mentions caching for GET endpoints; while less applicable to DELETE, validating cache invalidation or related headers is not present.

Idempotency & Soft-delete semantics: Tests do not explicitly assert idempotency semantics (repeated DELETEs on same resource) or whether deletion is soft vs hard (guidelines for DELETE mention soft deletes).
Response Content-Type and body shape on errors: While many error codes are asserted, there is no explicit check for response Content-Type (application/json) or standardized error payload structure.
Authorization granularity: Tests cover invalid token and missing header but do not check forbidden access (403) or role/permission based authorization variations.
recommendations: Add idempotency tests: repeated DELETE calls on the same invoiceItemId (after tags already removed) should return 204 and not cause side effects — assert system stability and soft-delete semantics if applicable.
Add rate limiting tests: send many DELETE requests rapidly to assert 429 or other throttling behavior per infra limits and verify appropriate Retry-After headers if applicable.
Add cache/invalidation tests if the system or proxied caches responses: ensure caches are invalidated or appropriate headers are returned after DELETE (or explicitly assert no-cache where required).
Verify response format on errors: assert Content-Type is application/json and error response payloads follow the API error schema for 4xx/5xx responses.
Add authorization role tests: include scenarios for 403 Forbidden when an authenticated user lacks permission to delete tags (if RBAC applies).
Clarify and add soft-delete semantics: if tags are soft-deleted or audit records kept, add assertions for audit log entries and examine persistence layer to confirm expected behavior.

Expand large-scale / bulk behavior tests beyond TC14: include deterministic limits (number of tagDef IDs accepted), and explicit assertions for 413 or configured maximums rather than ambiguous 204/413.
Add id validation combos for tagDef: tests for mixed valid+invalid UUIDs in tagDef (should fail or ignore invalids per spec) and explicit expectations for partial acceptance/rejection.
